menu

Class FileWriting

  • java.lang.Object
    • menu.FileWriting
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class FileWriting
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    FilWriting implements all file writing to userInfo.csv,userStatistics.csv and saving a game to whatever file the user selects. All userInfo after being pulled from the files is stored in ArrayList to compare with input from the user. As well to serialize the saved game all the objects neccessary are used as inputs.
    Author:
    Elliot Gimple
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public boolean loginIsValid(java.lang.String username,
                            java.lang.String password)
        This method oops through an arraylist of usernames and passwords and checks if there is a match. Then lets the user log in or rejects username and password combination
        Parameters:
        username - A string containing the user's username
        password - A string containing the user's password
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(java.lang.String realName,
                        java.lang.String username,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        java.lang.String retypePassword)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Wites the realname,username,password to the file at a new line this method is only called after having checked that the combination is a valid one.
        Parameters:
        realName - String of the user's realName
        username - String of the user's username
        password - String of the user's password
        retypePassword - String of retyping the user's password for verification purposes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • overwriteToFileString

        public void overwriteToFileString(java.lang.String realName,
                                  java.lang.String username,
                                  java.lang.String password,
                                  java.lang.String retypePassword)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        overwrites to file when the user tries to modify his account assuming correct input of realname and password The user is not allowed to modify his username
        Parameters:
        realName - String of user's realname.
        username - String of user's username not modifiable in this method
        password - String of user's password
        retypePassword - String of user's retyped password
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeToStatisticsFile

        public void writeToStatisticsFile(java.lang.String username,
                                  int score,
                                  int levelUnlocked)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        This writes to statistics the username, score and level unlocked. It will overwrite should the user already have a stored data point.
        Parameters:
        username - String user's username
        score - Int user's score
        levelUnlocked - Int levelUnlocked
        currentGameOfUser -
        Throws:

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame(java.lang.String fileName,
                     Level level,
                     Enemy enemy,
                     Player player,
                     Concrete concrete,
                     Brick brick,
                     PowerUps powerUps,
                     ExitWay exitWays,
                     Bomb bomb,
                     Grid grid,
                     int playerScore,
                     int currentLevel,
                     int currentLives,
                     int timer,
                     boolean flamePass,
                     boolean bombPass,
                     boolean wallPass,
                     boolean detonate)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Takes all the input neccesary to serialize the game and then save it in a file of the users choice. All of these objects are serializable
        Parameters:
        fileName - String filename of the saved game file
        level - Object of type Level storing all the level information
        enemy - Object of type Enemy storing all the enemy information
        player - Object of type Player storing all the player information
        concrete - Object of type Concrete storing all the concrete information.
        brick - Object of type Brick storing all the brick information.
        powerUps - Object of type PowerUps stores the all the powerups information.
        exitWays - Object of type ExitWays stores all the exitways information.
        bomb - Object of type Bomb stores all the Bomb information.
        grid - Object of type Grid stores all the grid information.
        playerScore - Integer storing the current player score.
        currentLevel - Integer storing the current level.
        currentLives - Integer storing the current level.
        timer - Int storing the time left in the timer.
        flamePass - Boolean of type flamePass does the player have the flamePass powerup.
        bombPass - Boolean of type bombPass does the player have the flamePass powerup.
        wallPass - Boolean of type wallPass does the player have the flamePass powerup.
        detonate - Boolean of type detonate does the player have the flamePass powerup.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
